You are implementing a Markdown-to-HTML converter in Python. === CRITICAL WORKFLOW (follow this order exactly) === 1. Read test_converter.py to understand what the tests expect 2. Run: .venv/bin/python -m pytest -v --tb=short (see all failing tests) 3. Create the markdown_converter/ package with these modules: - __init__.py (exports convert function) - lexer.py (tokenize markdown into block-level elements) - parser.py (build AST/intermediate representation from tokens) - inline_parser.py (handle bold, italic, code, links, images within text) - renderer.py (convert AST nodes to HTML strings) - converter.py (glue: lexer -> parser -> inline_parser -> renderer) 4. Run pytest after creating initial implementation 5. Fix failing tests one at a time with targeted patches 6. Repeat step 5 until all tests pass === RULES === - Do NOT use any third-party libraries. No pip install. Pure Python standard library only. - Do NOT rewrite files that are already working. Use targeted patches. - Do NOT rewrite test_converter.py. The tests are your acceptance criteria. - Work through files sequentially: finish one module before starting the next. - Run pytest frequently (after every significant change). - If a module is complete and its tests pass, move on. Do not polish working code. === SPEC === Supported Markdown elements: - ATX headings (# through ######) - Paragraphs (separated by blank lines) - Bold (**text** and __text__), Italic (*text* and _text_) - Inline code (`code`) - Fenced code blocks (``` with optional language annotation) - Unordered lists (-, *, +) nested to 3 levels - Ordered lists (1. 2. 3.) - Links [text](url), Images ![alt](src) - Horizontal rules (---, ***, ___) - Blockquotes (> prefix, nested with >>) Architecture MUST separate block parsing (lexer/parser) from inline parsing from HTML rendering. No regex soup. No single-pass string replacement. Output must be valid HTML5. The convert() function takes a markdown string and returns an HTML string. === PREVIOUS CONTEXT (if retrying) === --- PREVIOUS TEST OUTPUT --- $context.run_tests.stdout --- END TEST OUTPUT --- --- PREVIOUS REVIEW FEEDBACK --- $context.review.output --- END REVIEW FEEDBACK ---
